---
title: "Historical Append"
format: html
---

This form is to facilitate the transfer of previous sterility records. It works by having the function append on a new row and overwrite on to the exiting variable. 

```{r}
Archival <- function(Data=NULL, Date="", Day1AM="", Day2AM="",
 Day3AM="", Comments="", returnCSV=FALSE){

if (is.null(Data)){Data <- data.frame(Date=Date, Day1AM=Day1AM,
 Day2AM=Day2AM, Day3AM=Day3AM, Comments=Comments)
} else {
    Add <- data.frame(Date=Date, Day1AM=Day1AM,
    Day2AM=Day2AM, Day3AM=Day3AM, Comments=Comments)
    Data <- dplyr::bind_rows(Add, Data)
 }

if (returnCSV == TRUE){
    write.csv(Data, "SterilityChecks_Historical.csv", row.names=FALSE)
    }

return(Data)
}
```

# Start Here

```{r}
Data <- Archival(Date="2018-07-30", Day1AM="1", Day2AM="1", Day3AM="", Comments="", Data=Data)

```
